messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. I'm now focusing on endpoint `/users/{user}` with method GET, and here is the relevant information I found:

1. In `app/Http/Controllers/UserController.php`, `App\\Http\\Controllers\\UserController::show` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/users/{user}` with HTTP method GET.

2. In `app/Http/Controllers/UserController.php`, `App\\Http\\Controllers\\UserController::update` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/users/{user}` with HTTP method GET.

3. In `app/Http/Controllers/UserController.php`, `App\Http\Controllers\UserController::show` is implemented to process HTTP requests to `/users/{user}` with HTTP method GET.

I'll provide you with the contents of the files mentioned above, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to generate a list of Parameter Objects (the value of paths.[endpoint].[method].parameters) in Swagger 2.0 format.

You need to think step by step and provide an explanation of your results first. Then, output exactly "the final generated result begins", followed by the list of Parameter Objects in JSON format. Do not include fields not mentioned above, and do not use references ($ref) in your output (try to obtain the structure by executing additional Unix commands).

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Explanation:

- I inspected app/Http/Controllers/UserController::show and found it is the action that returns a view for an individual user.
- I checked routes/web.php and routes/api.php. routes/web.php registers Route::resource('users', UserController::class)->only('show'), which creates the GET /users/{user} route. routes/api.php also registers a users resource for API usage (index, show), but the path parameter name is the same: {user}.
- Laravel uses route model binding for {user} (the controller method signature is show(Request $request, User $user)), and database migrations define users.id as an auto-increment integer. Therefore the path parameter {user} is the User identifier (integer).
- Based on Swagger 2.0 Parameter Object fields, the parameter is a required path parameter named "user" of type integer. I include a short description and use the integer format int64.

the final generated result begins
[
  {
    "name": "user",
    "in": "path",
    "description": "ID of the user (route model binding to App\\Models\\User)",
    "required": true,
    "type": "integer",
    "format": "int64"
  }
]
